node.title: 'Unknown sailor' identified as 20-year-old Thomas Welsby Clark
node.description: Exactly 80Â years to the day after HMAS Sydney sank in a World War II battle, the identity of the only crew member ever recovered is revealed.
node.content:
["Exactly 80 years to the day after HMAS Sydney sank in a World War II battle, the identity of the only crew member ever recovered\u00a0has been revealed.", "Today at the Australian War Memorial in Canberra, the identity of the so-called unknown sailor was\u00a0revealed as 20-year-old Thomas Welsby Clark.\u00a0", "", "
The 'unknown sailor' has been named as\u00a0Thomas Welsby Clark.(Supplied: Australian War Memorial)
", "The remains of Able Seaman (AB) Clark\u00a0washed up on Christmas Island 11 weeks after the HMAS Sydney sank, following an\u00a0ambush\u00a0by German raider the Kormoran\u00a0off the coast of Western Australia.\u00a0", "Only one body was ever found, washed ashore on Christmas Island \u2014\u00a0and that body became known as the 'unknown sailor', until now.", "\"AB Clark was 20 years of age.\"", "The then-Ordinary Seaman Clark enlisted on August 23, 1940 and trained at HMAS St Giles and HMAS Cerberus.", "Then, on\u00a0August 19, 1941, he became a crew member of HMAS Sydney, achieving the ranking of Able Seaman just a few days later.", "Veterans Affairs Minister Andrew Gee said Mr Clark's was a remarkable Australian maritime story.\u00a0", "\"It was ferocious and it was brutal and Tom is believed to be the only person who made it to a life raft,\" he said this morning.\u00a0", "More to come."]
